trans-unit.source: Describes the requirements for declaring your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app as accessible in the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: Describes the requirements for declaring your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app as accessible in the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: While submitting your app to the Windows Store for certification, you can declare your app as accessible.
trans-unit.target: While submitting your app to the Windows Store for certification, you can declare your app as accessible.

trans-unit.source: Declaring your app as accessible makes it easier to discover for users who are interested in accessible apps, such as users who have visual impairments.
trans-unit.target: Declaring your app as accessible makes it easier to discover for users who are interested in accessible apps, such as users who have visual impairments.

trans-unit.source: Users discover accessible apps by using the **Accessible** filter while searching the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: Users discover accessible apps by using the **Accessible** filter while searching the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: Declaring your app as accessible also adds the **Accessible** tag to your app’s description.
trans-unit.target: Declaring your app as accessible also adds the **Accessible** tag to your app’s description.

trans-unit.source: By declaring your app as accessible, you state that it has the [basic accessibility information](basic-accessibility-information.md) that users need for primary scenarios using one or more of the following:
trans-unit.target: By declaring your app as accessible, you state that it has the [basic accessibility information](basic-accessibility-information.md) that users need for primary scenarios using one or more of the following:

trans-unit.source: The keyboard.
trans-unit.target: The keyboard.

trans-unit.source: A high contrast theme.
trans-unit.target: A high contrast theme.

trans-unit.source: A variable dots per inch (dpi) setting.
trans-unit.target: A variable dots per inch (dpi) setting.

trans-unit.source: Common assistive technology such as the Windows accessibility features, including Narrator, Magnifier, and On-Screen Keyboard.
trans-unit.target: Common assistive technology such as the Windows accessibility features, including Narrator, Magnifier, and On-Screen Keyboard.

trans-unit.source: You should declare your app as accessible if you built and tested it for accessibility.
trans-unit.target: You should declare your app as accessible if you built and tested it for accessibility.

trans-unit.source: This means that you did the following:
trans-unit.target: This means that you did the following:

trans-unit.source: Set all the relevant accessibility information for UI elements, including name, role, value, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Set all the relevant accessibility information for UI elements, including name, role, value, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Implemented full keyboard accessibility, enabling the user to:
trans-unit.target: Implemented full keyboard accessibility, enabling the user to:

trans-unit.source: Accomplish primary app scenarios by using only the keyboard.
trans-unit.target: Accomplish primary app scenarios by using only the keyboard.

trans-unit.source: Tab among UI elements in a logical order.
trans-unit.target: Tab among UI elements in a logical order.

trans-unit.source: Navigate among UI elements within a control by using the arrow keys.
trans-unit.target: Navigate among UI elements within a control by using the arrow keys.

trans-unit.source: Use keyboard shortcuts to reach primary app functionality.
trans-unit.target: Use keyboard shortcuts to reach primary app functionality.

trans-unit.source: Use Narrator touch gestures for Tab and arrow equivalency for devices with no keyboard.
trans-unit.target: Use Narrator touch gestures for Tab and arrow equivalency for devices with no keyboard.

trans-unit.source: Ensured that your app UI is visually accessible: has a minimum text contrast ratio of 4.5:1, does not rely on color alone to convey information, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Ensured that your app UI is visually accessible: has a minimum text contrast ratio of 4.5:1, does not rely on color alone to convey information, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Used accessibility testing tools such as [**Inspect**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Dd318521) and [**UIAVerify**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Hh920986) to verify your accessibility implementation, and resolved all priority 1 errors reported by such tools.
trans-unit.target: Used accessibility testing tools such as [**Inspect**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Dd318521) and [**UIAVerify**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Hh920986) to verify your accessibility implementation, and resolved all priority 1 errors reported by such tools.

trans-unit.source: Verified your app’s primary scenarios from end to end by using Narrator, Magnifier, On-Screen Keyboard, a high contrast theme, and adjusted dpi settings.
trans-unit.target: Verified your app’s primary scenarios from end to end by using Narrator, Magnifier, On-Screen Keyboard, a high contrast theme, and adjusted dpi settings.
